ground_truth: Behind the shield, a faint light flashes on and off from the bedroom window of a suburban house. The light is flashing from beneath a bed sheet. Harry Potter suddenly emerges from under the sheet and pretends to be asleep. Uncle Vernon, wearing a dressing gown, puts on the light and glares around the room. He switches off the light and goes out. Harry pulls the sheet back over his head. He waves the wand over a spell book. The wand glows brightly. It glows even more brightly. The light flashes again under the sheet. Uncle Vernon looks in again, but Harry pretends to be asleep. Harry snuggles down in bed. Daylight. Aunt Marge thrusts a wet umbrella at Harry. She bustles into the sitting room with her bulldog with her. She greets her nephew, Dudley. Harry clears the table. Ripper licks her plate. She gives Ripper brandy and glares at Harry. Uncle Vernon gives Harry a warning look. Her glass shatters. She clicks her fingers at Harry. Harry shakes with rage. Lights start to flash and plates rattle. As Aunt Marge wags her finger at Harry, the tip begins to swell. Her cheeks bulge. Her bottom swells to fill the chair. Ladders appear in her stockings as her legs grow to twice their normal size. The seams on her tweed jacket burst apart. Her neck inflates. The top button of her blouse pings across the room and hits the clock. Vernon and Petunia watch with horror. Dudley goes on eating. Ripper bites Vernon's leg. Aunt Marge rises into the air. The beads of her necklace scatter. She bursts out of the chair. A flying button hits Dudley. A second button knocks him sideways. Marge grabs the tablecloth. She floats even higher and hits the ceiling. Aunt Marge turns upside down showing her bloomers and floats into the conservatory. She bumps against the glass roof. She sails out into the garden. Vernon struggles after her with Ripper clinging to his leg. He grasps her hands. Ripper's still attached. All three are lifted off the ground. Vernon lets go and falls onto the grass. Aunt Marge floats away like a huge balloon. Helplessly, Vernon and Petunia gaze after her. Dudley is still eating and watching television. Harry quickly runs upstairs, angrily kicking the cupboard. He sits on his bed. He looks at the photograph on the bedside table of his parents dancing happily together. He drags his trunk down the stairs. He points his wand at Vernon. Harry leaves the house dragging his trunk on a small set of wheels. In the distance, Aunt Marge is a faint speck in the darkening sky. Harry walks quickly, breathing hard as he pulls the heavy trunk along the deserted streets.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Behind the barrier, a dim glow flickers on and off from the bedroom casement of a suburban dwelling. The glow is flickering from underneath a bed covering. Harry Potter suddenly appears from under the covering and feigns to be slumbering. Uncle Vernon, clad in a robe, clicks on the glow and stares around the chamber. He flicks off the glow and departs. Harry tugs the covering back over his head. He waves the wand over a charm volume. The wand gleams luminously. It gleams even more luminously. The glow flickers again beneath the covering. Uncle Vernon peers in again, but Harry feigns to be slumbering. Harry cuddles down in bed. Daylight. Aunt Marge thrusts a moist umbrella at Harry. She hustles into the lounge with her bulldog with her. She welcomes her nephew, Dudley. Harry clears the table. Ripper licks her platter. She gives Ripper liquor and stares at Harry. Uncle Vernon gives Harry a cautionary glance. Her glass shatters. She snaps her digits at Harry. Harry trembles with fury. Lights commence to flicker and platters clatter. As Aunt Marge wags her digit at Harry, the tip begins to inflate. Her cheeks swell. Her bottom enlarges to fill the chair. Ladders manifest in her hosiery as her legs expand to twice their usual magnitude. The seams on her tweed jacket rupture apart. Her neck balloons. The top fastener of her blouse pings across the chamber and strikes the chronometer. Vernon and Petunia watch with terror. Dudley continues munching. Ripper chomps Vernon's limb. Aunt Marge ascends into the air. The beads of her necklace disperse. She bursts out of the chair. A flying fastener strikes Dudley. A second fastener knocks him sideways. Marge clutches the tablecloth. She levitates even higher and strikes the ceiling. Aunt Marge rotates inverted showing her pantaloons and floats into the greenhouse. She bumps against the glass roof. She sails out into the yard. Vernon struggles after her with Ripper clinging to his limb. He seizes her hands. Ripper's still attached. All three are lifted off the terrain. Vernon lets go and falls onto the grass. Aunt Marge floats away like a huge balloon. Helplessly, Vernon and Petunia gaze after her. Dudley is still munching and viewing television. Harry quickly runs upstairs, furiously kicking the cabinet. He sits on his bed. He looks at the photograph on the bedside table of his parents dancing joyfully together. He drags his trunk down the stairs. He points his wand at Vernon. Harry leaves the dwelling dragging his trunk on a small set of wheels. In the distance, Aunt Marge is a dim speck in the darkening sky. Harry walks quickly, inhaling hard as he pulls the heavy trunk along the deserted thoroughfares.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Behind the shield, a faint light is flashed on and off from the bedroom window of a suburban house. The light flashes from beneath a bed sheet. Suddenly, Harry Potter is emerged from under the sheet and he pretends to be asleep. The light is put on by Uncle Vernon, wearing a dressing gown, and he glares around the room. The light is switched off by him, and he goes out. The sheet is pulled back over his head by Harry. A spell book is waved over by him with the wand. The wand is glowed brightly. It is glowed even more brightly. The sheet is flashed again by the light. Uncle Vernon looks in again, but Harry pretends to be asleep. The bed is snuggled down into by Harry. Daylight. Aunt Marge is thrusting a wet umbrella at Harry. The sitting room is bustled into by her with her bulldog. Her nephew, Dudley, is greeted by her. The table is cleared by Harry. Her plate is licked by Ripper. Brandy is given by her to Ripper and Harry is glared at by her. A warning look is given to Harry by Uncle Vernon. Her glass is shattered. Harry clicks his fingers at her. Rage shakes Harry. Lights are started to flash and plates are rattled. As Harry wags Aunt Marge’s finger at her, the tip is begun to swell. Her cheeks are bulged. Her bottom is swelled to fill the chair. Ladders in her stockings appear as her legs are grown to twice their normal size. The seams on her tweed jacket are burst apart. Her neck is inflated. The top button of her blouse is pinged across the room by her and it hits the clock. Horror watches Vernon and Petunia. Eating is continued by Dudley. Vernon's leg is bitten by Ripper. Into the air, Aunt Marge is risen. The necklace beads of hers are scattered. Out of the chair, she is burst by the ballooning Aunt Marge. Dudley is hit by a flying button. He is knocked sideways by a second button. The tablecloth is grabbed by Marge. She is floated even higher and the ceiling is hit by her. Her bloomers are shown as Aunt Marge turns upside down and the conservatory is floated into by her. The glass roof is bumped against by her. Into the garden, she is sailed. After her, Vernon struggles with Ripper clinging to his leg. Her hands are grasped by him. Ripper is still attached. Off the ground, all three are lifted. The grass is fallen onto by Vernon after he lets go. Aunt Marge is floated away by herself like a huge balloon. Helplessly, Vernon and Petunia after her gaze. Television is still watched by Dudley while eating. Upstairs, Harry is quickly run, the cupboard is angrily kicked by him. On his bed, he sits. The photograph on the bedside table of his parents dancing happily together is looked at by him. Down the stairs, his trunk is dragged by him. At Vernon, the wand is pointed by Harry. The house is left by Harry, his trunk on a small set of wheels is dragged by him. In the distance, a faint speck in the darkening sky is Aunt Marge. Quickly, Harry walks, breathing hard as the heavy trunk is pulled along the deserted streets by him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Behind the shield, a soft light flickers on and off from a bedroom window in a suburban house. The light comes from under a bed sheet. Harry Potter suddenly emerges and pretends to sleep. Uncle Vernon, in a dressing gown, enters, turns on the light, glares, switches it off, and leaves. Harry pulls the sheet back over his head, waving a glowing wand over a spell book. The light flashes again. Uncle Vernon checks in, but Harry feigns sleep. Harry snuggles down. Daylight. Aunt Marge thrusts a wet umbrella at Harry as she enters the sitting room with her bulldog, greeting Dudley. Ripper licks her plate, she gives it brandy, and glares at Harry. Uncle Vernon warns Harry. Her glass shatters; she snaps at Harry. Harry shakes with rage, causing lights to flash and plates to rattle. Aunt Marge's finger swells, cheeks bulge, and body expands, bursting her clothes. Vernon and Petunia watch in horror, Dudley keeps eating. Ripper bites Vernon as Aunt Marge rises into the air, scattering necklace beads. She floats higher, hits the ceiling, turns upside down, and drifts into the conservatory, bumping the glass roof before sailing into the garden. Vernon, struggling with Ripper on his leg, grabs Marge, but all three lift off the ground. Vernon falls onto the grass as Aunt Marge floats away like a balloon. Vernon and Petunia gaze helplessly; Dudley keeps eating. Harry runs upstairs, kicks the cupboard angrily, and sits on his bed, looking at a photo of his happy parents. He drags his trunk downstairs, points his wand at Vernon, and leaves, pulling his trunk on wheels. Aunt Marge is a faint speck in the sky as Harry walks quickly, breathing hard on the deserted streets.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Behind a shield, light flickers from a bedroom window beneath a sheet. Harry Potter emerges, pretends to sleep as Uncle Vernon, in a dressing gown, checks the room, then exits. Harry uses a glowing wand under the sheet. Vernon checks again, but Harry feigns sleep. As daylight comes, Aunt Marge enters with her bulldog, greets Dudley, and glares at Harry, who clears the table. She gives her dog brandy, shattering a glass and clicking at Harry, whose rage causes lights to flash and plates to rattle. As she wags her finger, her body swells, seams burst, and she rises, scattering beads and hitting the ceiling. She floats into the garden, Vernon chasing her with the dog clinging to his leg. Vernon falls, and Aunt Marge drifts away. Dudley keeps eating. Harry storms upstairs, looks at a photo of his happy parents, then drags his trunk downstairs, points his wand at Vernon, and leaves. Aunt Marge becomes a speck in the sky as Harry pulls his trunk down empty streets.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Behind the protective shield of the suburban neighborhood, a faint and intermittent light quietly flashes on and off from the window of a bedroom inside an ordinary house. The source of this flickering light is from beneath a bed sheet, where Harry Potter is hidden. In a sudden movement, he emerges from under the cocooning sheet, only to pretend he is in a deep sleep. Uncle Vernon, clad in a dressing gown, turns on the room light and casts a suspicious glare around the dimly lit room. Finding nothing amiss, he switches off the light again and exits the room. Once the coast is clear, Harry pulls the sheet back over his head and waves his wand over a spell book. The wand glows brightly, casting a luminescent glow that grows even more intense. The mysterious light under the sheet flashes once again. Uncle Vernon peeks in for a second time, but Harry continues his act of pretending to be sound asleep. Feeling somewhat secure, Harry snuggles down into his bed again. 

The scene transitions to daylight. Aunt Marge, with her imposing presence, thrusts a wet umbrella rudely at Harry. She bustles her way into the cozy sitting room with her bulldog accompanying her. She extends a brusque greeting to her nephew, Dudley. Meanwhile, Harry busies himself with the task of clearing the table. The bulldog, Ripper, licks her plate clean. Aunt Marge indulges Ripper with a bit of brandy, then fixes an intimidating glare at Harry. Uncle Vernon flashes a warning look in Harry’s direction. Suddenly, her glass surprisingly shatters. She clicks her fingers imperiously at Harry, causing him to shake with mounting rage. Instantly, the lights around the room start to flash erratically, and the plates rattle as if possessing a life of their own. As Aunt Marge wags her finger disapprovingly at Harry, the end of her finger begins to swell alarmingly. Her cheeks puff out noticeably, and her bottom expands to fill the entirety of the chair. Ladders start to appear in her stockings as her legs bizarrely grow to twice their normal size. The seams on her tweed jacket burst apart dramatically. Her neck inflates like a balloon. The top button of her blouse pings across the room with force and hits the clock. Vernon and Petunia watch the grotesque transformation unfold with horror-stricken eyes. Dudley, unfazed, continues eating his meal. Ripper bites down on Vernon's leg, causing him to yelp in pain. 

In the scene of chaos, Aunt Marge begins to rise into the air like an overinflated balloon. The beads of her necklace scatter in all directions. She bursts out of the confines of the chair. A flying button hits Dudley, while a second button knocks him sideways. Desperate to anchor herself, Marge grabs onto the tablecloth. She floats even higher, her body hitting the ceiling. Aunt Marge turns upside down, revealing her bloomers, and drifts into the conservatory. She bumps against the glass roof and then sails out into the garden. Vernon struggles to follow after her, Ripper still clamped onto his leg. He desperately grasps her hands. With Ripper still attached, all three lift off the ground. Vernon, losing his grip, lets go and falls back onto the grass. Aunt Marge, unstoppable, floats away into the distance, resembling a huge balloon vanishing into the sky. Helplessly, Vernon and Petunia watch her rise higher and higher. Meanwhile, Dudley remains seated, watching television and continuing to eat. 

Filled with determination, Harry quickly runs upstairs and angrily kicks the cupboard in frustration. He sits momentarily on his bed, looking at the cherished photograph on his bedside table of his parents dancing together happily. Resolute, he drags his heavy trunk down the stairs. With determination, he points his wand at Vernon as a final warning. Harry leaves the house, dragging his trunk on a small set of wheels behind him. In the distance, Aunt Marge is now just a faint speck in the darkening evening sky. Harry walks away quickly, breathing hard as he pulls the heavy trunk along the deserted streets, leaving his old life behind.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Nestled within the protective and comforting embrace of a suburban neighborhood, a faint and intermittent light flickers quietly on and off from the window of a bedroom inside what appears to be an ordinary house. This source of flickering light originates from beneath a bed sheet, beneath which young Harry Potter is cleverly hidden. In one swift and sudden movement, he emerges from under the cocooning sheet, only to immediately assume the posture of someone who is in a deep, restful sleep. Uncle Vernon, clad in his dressing gown, switches on the room light, casting a suspicious glare throughout the dimly lit room. Upon finding nothing out of place or amiss, he turns off the light once again and leaves the room without another word. Once the coast is clear, and he feels safe, Harry carefully pulls the sheet back over his head and waves his wand over a spell book. The wand glows brightly, its luminescent glow growing even more intense with each passing moment. The mysterious light under the sheet flickers once more. Uncle Vernon peeks in for a second time, but Harry continues his charade of pretending to be sound asleep, undisturbed by the commotion. Feeling somewhat secure after the ruse, Harry snuggles down comfortably into his bed again.

The scene transitions seamlessly into daylight. Aunt Marge, with her imposing presence, rudely thrusts a wet umbrella at Harry. She makes her way into the cozy and welcoming sitting room, her loyal bulldog accompanying her. She extends a brusque and curt greeting to her nephew, Dudley. Meanwhile, Harry busies himself with the task of cleaning off the table. The bulldog, Ripper, eagerly licks her plate clean, savoring every scrap. Aunt Marge indulges Ripper with a splash of brandy, before fixing an intimidating glare at Harry. Uncle Vernon flashes a warning look in Harry’s direction, signaling him to keep his composure. Suddenly, without warning, her glass surprisingly shatters. She clicks her fingers imperiously at Harry, causing him to tremble with mounting rage. Instantly, the lights around the room start to flash erratically, and the plates rattle as if they possess a life of their own. As Aunt Marge wags her finger disapprovingly at Harry, the end of her finger begins to swell alarmingly, much to her dismay. Her cheeks puff out noticeably, and her bottom expands until it fills the entirety of the chair. Ladders begin to appear in her stockings as her legs bizarrely swell to twice their normal size. The seams on her tweed jacket burst apart dramatically. Her neck inflates like a rapidly growing balloon. The top button of her blouse pings across the room with great force, hitting the clock. Vernon and Petunia watch the grotesque transformation unfold with horror-stricken eyes. Dudley, however, remains unfazed and continues eating his meal, seemingly oblivious to the chaos. Ripper bites down viciously on Vernon's leg, causing him to let out a yelp of pain.

In the midst of the scene of chaos, Aunt Marge begins to rise into the air like an overinflated balloon. The beads of her necklace scatter in all directions. She bursts out of the confines of the chair. A flying button hits Dudley, and a second button knocks him sideways. Desperate to anchor herself, Marge grabs onto the tablecloth. She floats even higher, her body colliding with the ceiling. Aunt Marge turns upside down, revealing her bloomers, and drifts into the conservatory. She bumps against the glass roof and then sails out into the garden. Vernon struggles to follow after her, Ripper still clamped onto his leg. He desperately grasps her hands. With Ripper still attached, all three inexplicably lift off the ground. Vernon loses his grip and falls back onto the grass. Aunt Marge, seemingly unstoppable, floats away into the distance, resembling a huge balloon vanishing into the sky. Helplessly, Vernon and Petunia watch her rise higher and higher. Meanwhile, Dudley remains seated, watching television and continuing to eat, unaffected by the mayhem around him.

Filled with determination, Harry quickly runs upstairs and angrily kicks the cupboard, overcome with frustration. He sits momentarily on his bed, gazing at the cherished photograph on his bedside table of his parents dancing together, caught in a moment of happiness. Resolute, he drags his heavy trunk down the stairs. With determination, he points his wand at Vernon as a final warning, his intentions clear. Harry leaves the house, dragging his trunk on a small set of wheels behind him. In the distance, Aunt Marge is now just a faint speck in the darkening evening sky, becoming a distant memory. Harry walks away briskly, breathing heavily as he pulls the heavy trunk along the deserted streets, leaving his old life firmly behind him.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the suburban house, behind the shield of an unassuming exterior, a faint light flickers intermittently in the darkness of a bedroom, emanating from beneath a bed sheet. This light, cloaked in secrecy, is the handiwork of young Harry Potter, who suddenly emerges from under the sheet in a spontaneous motion, feigning the innocence of sleep. Uncle Vernon, clad in a dressing gown that drapes loosely over his frame, enters the room with purpose, flicking on the overhead light with a swift motion and casting a scrutinizing gaze around the dimly lit space. His eyes search for any irregularities before he decisively flips the switch again, plunging the room back into its prior state of gloom as he exits. Harry, quick to seize the moment, pulls the bed sheet back over his head with calculated stealth. Beneath its soft folds, he waves his wand over a spell book, causing the wand to emit an increasingly bright glow, its luminescence escalating to a near-blinding flash. The light pulses once more beneath the cover of darkness. Uncle Vernon, alerted again, casts another suspicious glance into the room, but Harry, with practiced ease, maintains his ruse of slumber. Settling back into the comfort of his bed, Harry snuggles down, secure in the temporary quiet. With the advent of daylight, the scene shifts as Aunt Marge, equipped with a wet umbrella, thrusts it unceremoniously at Harry, making her way into the sitting room where she is accompanied by her ever-present bulldog companion. She jovially greets her rotund nephew, Dudley, as Harry dutifully clears the table in silent compliance. Ripper, the bulldog, opportunistically licks Marge's plate clean. Oblivious to decorum, Marge indulges Ripper with brandy, glaring at Harry with a look of contempt. Uncle Vernon, catching Harry's eye, accompanies Marge's stare with one of warning. Suddenly, the tension in the room escalates as Marge's glass shatters inexplicably. She commands Harry's attention with a curt snap of her fingers, an act that sends him into a shaking fit of suppressed rage. The air becomes charged as lights flash erratically and plates clatter in response to the heightened atmosphere. As Aunt Marge wags an accusing finger in Harry's direction, her body undergoes a grotesque transformation; the tip of her finger begins to swell noticeably, soon followed by the inflation of her cheeks and a rapid expansion of her bottom until it fills the chair entirely. Her stockings resign to the strain, ladders forming conspicuously as her legs balloon to double their usual size. The seams of her tweed jacket surrender to the pressure, splitting apart with a sound that echoes through the room. Her neck inflates rapidly, the top button of her blouse catapulting across the room, ricocheting off the clock with a distinct ping. Vernon and Petunia, witnesses to this bizarre spectacle, watch paralytically as Dudley continues unperturbed, more preoccupied with his meal. Ripper, in a sudden frenzy, clamps down on Vernon’s leg, while Aunt Marge defies gravity, rising into the air, her necklace scattering beads in all directions as she bursts from the confines of her chair. A flying button makes contact with Dudley, jolting him sideways from his spot. Marge, in her panic, clutches at the tablecloth, but this only accelerates her ascent as she collides with the ceiling. Turning topsy-turvy, bloomer-exposed, she drifts into the conservatory, bumping persistently against the glass roof before escaping into the garden. Vernon, in an unwieldy pursuit with Ripper still attached to his leg, reaches for her hands in a desperate attempt to anchor her. Yet, all three find themselves momentarily airborne before Vernon loses his grip, tumbling back onto the grass below. Marge continues her celestial journey, an enormous balloon silhouetted against the sky, leaving Vernon and Petunia to gaze, helplessly trailing her with their eyes. Amidst this chaos, Dudley remains absorbed in his television program, unfazed and munching on his meal. In a surge of emotion, Harry darts upstairs, his feet heavy as he angrily kicks the cupboard in passing. Seated on his bed, he contemplates a photograph resting on the bedside table, capturing his parents in a moment of joy as they dance together. Resolute, he drags his trunk down the stairs with visible determination, pointing his wand at Vernon in a silent threat before departing the house. Outside, he hauls the trunk, its wheels clattering softly against the pavement, and in the darkening sky, the distant figure of Aunt Marge becomes a mere speck. Harry strides briskly, his breath labored, as he navigates the deserted streets, towing the cumbersome trunk behind him.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Behind the shield, a faint light intermittently flashes from the bedroom window of a suburban house. Harry Potter emerges from beneath a bed sheet, pretending to be asleep as Uncle Vernon, in his dressing gown, enters, switches on the light, glares around, and then exits. Once alone, Harry conceals himself again under the sheet, waves his wand over a spell book, causing it to glow increasingly brighter, before feigning sleep once more as Uncle Vernon checks in. Later, Aunt Marge arrives, thrusting a wet umbrella at Harry and bustling into the sitting room with her bulldog. After greeting her nephew Dudley, Harry clears the table while Ripper licks her plate. Aunt Marge glares at Harry, gives the dog brandy, and shatters a glass, prompting Uncle Vernon to warn Harry. As her frustration grows, Marge's physique starts to expand; lights flash, and plates rattle. Her body swells until her clothing bursts, and she begins to levitate, scattering beads and buttons as Vernon, Petunia, and Dudley react with varied disinterest or horror. Despite Vernon's attempt to hold her down, he is bitten by Ripper and eventually lets go, leading to Marge's ascent into the garden and beyond, much to the helpless onlookers' dismay. Meanwhile, Harry retreats upstairs, vents his anger by kicking a cupboard, briefly looks at a photograph of his dancing parents, and then drags his trunk downstairs. Confronting Vernon with his wand, Harry departs, pulling his trunk through the deserted streets as Aunt Marge becomes a distant speck in the night sky.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Behind the shield of the thick curtains, a faint light flashes on and off from the bedroom window of a typical British suburban house, often characterized by its semi-detached style. The light is flashing from beneath a bed sheet. Harry Potter, the orphaned boy who discovered he was a wizard on his eleventh birthday, suddenly emerges from under the sheet and pretends to be asleep. Uncle Vernon, dressed in a dressing gown, which is a British term for a bathrobe, puts on the light and glares around the room. He switches off the light and goes out. Harry pulls the sheet back over his head. He waves the wand—a magical tool essential for casting spells in the wizarding world—over a spell book. The wand glows brightly, illuminating the pages filled with enchantments. It glows even more brightly. The light flashes again under the sheet. Uncle Vernon looks in again, but Harry pretends to be asleep. Harry snuggles down in bed. Daylight. Aunt Marge, known for her disdain of Harry, thrusts a wet umbrella at him as she arrives for her annual visit. She bustles into the sitting room with her bulldog, Ripper, fiercely loyal to her, with her. She greets her nephew, Dudley, who is often spoiled with treats and gifts. Harry clears the table. True to his breed's nature, Ripper licks her plate. She gives Ripper brandy, a notorious habit of hers, and glares at Harry. Uncle Vernon gives Harry a warning look, a silent command to behave. Her glass shatters due to Harry's involuntary magical outburst. She clicks her fingers at Harry. Harry shakes with rage, his emotions triggering his uncontrolled magic. Lights start to flash and plates rattle ominously. As Aunt Marge wags her finger at Harry, the tip begins to swell, a consequence of Harry's anger-fueled magic. Her cheeks bulge. Her bottom swells to fill the chair. Ladders appear in her stockings as her legs grow to twice their normal size. The seams on her tweed jacket, typical of her stern and old-fashioned style, burst apart. Her neck inflates. The top button of her blouse pings across the room and hits the clock with a resounding clink. Vernon and Petunia watch with horror, unable to intervene. Dudley goes on eating, unfazed by the chaos. Ripper bites Vernon's leg in confusion. Aunt Marge rises into the air, her body swelling like an inflated dirigible. The beads of her necklace scatter. She bursts out of the chair. A flying button hits Dudley, who barely notices. A second button knocks him sideways, briefly interrupting his meal. Marge grabs the tablecloth in a futile attempt to anchor herself. She floats even higher and hits the ceiling. Aunt Marge turns upside down, showing her bloomers, an embarrassing sight, and floats into the conservatory, a room designed for relaxation and enjoying sunlight. She bumps against the glass roof, her body a prisoner of the unintended spell. She sails out into the garden, a space filled with neatly trimmed hedges and flowerbeds. Vernon struggles after her with Ripper clinging to his leg, the dog hanging on for dear life. He grasps her hands, trying to pull her down. Ripper's still attached, adding to the weight. All three are lifted off the ground momentarily. Vernon lets go and falls onto the grass with a thud. Aunt Marge floats away like a huge balloon, her figure disappearing into the sky. Helplessly, Vernon and Petunia gaze after her, shocked and powerless. Dudley is still eating and watching television, his attention barely diverted. Harry quickly runs upstairs, angrily kicking the cupboard under the stairs, which once served as his bedroom. He sits on his bed, a refuge from the mayhem. He looks at the photograph on the bedside table of his parents, James and Lily Potter, dancing happily together, a cherished memory of people he barely knew. He drags his trunk, marked with the Hogwarts crest, down the stairs. He points his wand at Vernon, a gesture of empowerment against years of mistreatment. Harry leaves the house, dragging his trunk on a small set of wheels, which clatter on the pavement. In the distance, Aunt Marge is a faint speck in the darkening sky, her angry shouts growing fainter. Harry walks quickly, breathing hard as he pulls the heavy trunk along the deserted streets, each step taking him closer to freedom and his true home at Hogwarts.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Behind the shield a faint light flashes on and off from the bedroom window of a suburban house. The light is flashing from beneath a bed sheet. Harry Potter suddenly emerges from under the sheet and pretends to be asleep. Uncle Vernon wearing a dressing gown puts on the light and glares around the room. He switches off the light and goes out. Harry pulls the sheet back over his head. He waves the wand over a spell book. The wand glows brightly. It glows even more brightly. The light flashes again under the sheet. Uncle Vernon looks in again but Harry pretends to be asleep. Harry snuggles down in bed. Daylight. Aunt Marge thrusts a wet umbrella at Harry. She bustles into the sitting room with her bulldog with her. She greets her nephew Dudley. Harry clears the table. Ripper licks her plate. She gives Ripper brandy and glares at Harry. Uncle Vernon gives Harry a warning look. Her glass shatters. She clicks her fingers at Harry. Harry shakes with rage. Lights start to flash and plates rattle. As Aunt Marge wags her finger at Harry the tip begins to swell. Her cheeks bulge. Her bottom swells to fill the chair. Ladders appear in her stockings as her legs grow to twice their normal size. The seams on her tweed jacket burst apart. Her neck inflates. The top button of her blouse pings across the room and hits the clock. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Vernon and Petunia watch with horror. Dudley goes on eating. Ripper bites Vernon's leg. Aunt Marge rises into the air. The beads of her necklace scatter. She bursts out of the chair. A flying button hits Dudley. A second button knocks him sideways. Marge grabs the tablecloth. She floats even higher and hits the ceiling. Aunt Marge turns upside down showing her bloomers and floats into the conservatory. She bumps against the glass roof. She sails out into the garden. Vernon struggles after her with Ripper clinging to his leg. He grasps her hands. Ripper's still attached. All three are lifted off the ground. Vernon let us go and falls onto the grass. Aunt Marge floats away like a huge balloon. Helplessly. Vernon and Petunia gaze after her. Dudley is still eating and watching television. Harry quickly runs upstairs angrily kicking the cupboard. He sits on his bed. He looks at the photograph on the bedside table of his parents dancing happily together. He drags his trunk down the stairs. He points his wand at Vernon. Harry leaves the house dragging his trunk on a small set of wheels. In the distance. Aunt Marge is a faint speck in the darkening sky. Harry walks quickly breathing hard as he pulls the heavy trunk along the deserted streets.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Behind the shield a faint light flashes on and off from the bedroom window of a suburban house. The light is flashing from beneath a bed sheet. Harry Potter suddenly emerges from under the sheet and pretends to be asleep. Uncle Vernon wearing a dressing gown puts on the light and glares around the room. He switches off the light and goes out. Harry pulls the sheet back over his head. He waves the wand over a spell book. The wand glows brightly. It glows even more brightly. The light flashes again under the sheet. Uncle Vernon looks in again but Harry pretends to be asleep. Harry snuggles down in bed. Daylight. Aunt Marge thrusts a wet umbrella at Harry. She bustles into the sitting room with her bulldog with her. She greets her nephew Dudley. Harry clears the table. Ripper licks her plate. She gives Ripper brandy and glares at Harry. Uncle Vernon gives Harry a warning look. Her glass shatters. She clicks her fingers at Harry. Harry shakes with rage. Lights start to flash and plates rattle. As Aunt Marge wags her finger at Harry the tip begins to swell. Her cheeks bulge. Her bottom swells to fill the chair. Ladders appear in her stockings as her legs grow to twice their normal size. The seams on her tweed jacket burst apart. Her neck inflates. The top button of her blouse pings across the room and hits the clock. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Beyond the curtain, a dim bell flickers on and off from the attic skylight of a rural cabin. The bell is flickering from beneath a pillowcase. Sherlock Holmes suddenly pops out from under the pillowcase and pretends to be napping. Uncle Charlie, clad in a trench coat, turns on the bell and squints around the space. He turns off the bell and steps out. Sherlock wraps the pillowcase back over his face. He swings the net over a potion jar. The net sparkles dimly. It sparkles even more dimly. The bell flickers again under the pillowcase. Uncle Charlie peeks in again, but Sherlock pretends to be napping. Sherlock curls up in the hammock. Morning. Aunt Lydia thrusts a dry broomstick at Sherlock. She bustles into the drawing room with her cat beside her. She welcomes her cousin, Bobby. Sherlock wipes the counter. Whiskers nibbles her bowl. She offers Whiskers milk and scowls at Sherlock. Uncle Charlie gives Sherlock a stern glance. Her mug cracks. She snaps her thumb at Sherlock. Sherlock trembles with anger. Bells start to flicker and bowls clatter. As Aunt Lydia wags her hand at Sherlock, the fingernail begins to expand. Her ears puff up. Her waist inflates to fill the sofa. Holes appear in her stockings as her feet stretch to twice their usual size. The buttons on her wool coat pop apart. Her collar swells. The clasp of her necklace snaps across the room and hits the calendar. Charlie and Harriet watch with terror. Bobby continues chomping. Whiskers nips Charlie's elbow. Aunt Lydia ascends into the atmosphere. The pearls of her bracelet scatter. She pops out of the couch. A flying button strikes Bobby. A second button tips him backward. Lydia clutches the table leg. She drifts even higher and touches the rafters. Aunt Lydia flips upside down showing her pajamas and drifts into the greenhouse. She nudges the glass ceiling. She drifts out into the orchard. Charlie stumbles after her with Whiskers gripping his hand. He clasps her fingers. Whiskers is still latched on. All three rise off the terrain. Charlie releases and lands onto the dirt. Aunt Lydia drifts away like a gigantic kite. Powerlessly, Charlie and Harriet stare after her. Bobby is still chomping and watching cartoons. Sherlock swiftly climbs upstairs, furiously kicking the closet. He lands on his couch. He glances at the painting on the mantelpiece of his friends laughing joyfully together. He hauls his suitcase down the ladder. He aims his net at Charlie. Sherlock exits the cabin hauling his suitcase on a small pair of skates. In the distance, Aunt Lydia is a faint dot in the dimming horizon. Sherlock strides briskly, panting deeply as he tugs the heavy suitcase along the empty pathways.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Inside a suburban house, a faint light flashes from Harry Potter's bedroom window. Under his bedsheet, he uses a glowing wand on a spell book but pretends to sleep when Uncle Vernon checks. The next day, Aunt Marge arrives with her bulldog, Ripper, who licks her plate. Marge's rude behavior angers Harry, causing lights to flash and plates to rattle. As her taunting continues, Marge begins to inflate, her body expanding until she floats into the conservatory and then into the garden. Uncle Vernon attempts to hold onto her but is pulled off the ground before falling. Harry, filled with rage, packs his trunk, looks wistfully at a photo of his parents, and leaves, pointing his wand at Vernon. Aunt Marge disappears into the sky as Harry drags his trunk through the darkening streets.
